content:
TITLE: Adding RxJava Core Maven Dependency
DESCRIPTION: Maven dependency configuration block for including RxJava core library in a project. Specifies the Netflix RxJava core artifact with version 0.19.0.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ReactiveX/reactivex.github.io/blob/develop/examples/binaries/maven.txt#2025-04-06_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: xml
CODE:
```
<dependency>
    <groupId>com.netflix.rxjava</groupId>
    <artifactId>rxjava-core</artifactId>
    <version>0.19.0</version>
</dependency>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding RxJava Scala module dependency in SBT
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to add the RxJava Scala module as a dependency in an SBT build file. It specifies the Maven coordinates for the rxjava-scala library at version 0.17.0, published by Netflix.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ReactiveX/reactivex.github.io/blob/develop/examples/binaries/sbt.txt#2025-04-06_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sbt
CODE:
```
libraryDependencies += "com.netflix.rxjava" % "rxjava-scala" % "0.17.0"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Docker to Build and Run ReactiveX Website
DESCRIPTION: A one-liner command to build and run the ReactiveX website using Docker. This mounts the current directory to the container for development and exposes port 4000.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ReactiveX/reactivex.github.io/blob/develop/README.md#2025-04-06_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker build -t reactivex.io - < Dockerfile && docker run -p 4000:4000 -it --rm -v $PWD:/app -t reactivex.io
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: RxJava Download POM Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Complete Maven POM file configuration for downloading RxJava core and its dependencies as JAR files. Includes project metadata and dependency specification for RxJava version 0.17.0.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ReactiveX/reactivex.github.io/blob/develop/examples/binaries/maven.txt#2025-04-06_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: xml
CODE:
```
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
  <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>
  <groupId>com.netflix.rxjava.download</groupId>
  <artifactId>rxjava-download</artifactId>
  <version>1.0-SNAPSHOT</version>
  <name>Simple POM to download rxjava-core and dependencies</name>
  <url>http://github.com/Netflix/RxJava</url>
  <dependencies>
    <dependency>
      <groupId>com.netflix.rxjava</groupId>
      <artifactId>rxjava-core</artifactId>
      <version>0.17.0</version>
      <scope/>
    </dependency>
  </dependencies>
</project>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Required Tools for ReactiveX Website Development
DESCRIPTION: Commands to install Jekyll (static site generator), Uglifier, Rake, and LESS which are required build tools for JavaScript and CSS compilation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ReactiveX/reactivex.github.io/blob/develop/README.md#2025-04-06_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ gem install jekyll uglifier rake
$ npm install -g less
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running the ReactiveX Website Development Server
DESCRIPTION: Command to run the default Rake task which compiles styles and starts the Jekyll server for local development.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ReactiveX/reactivex.github.io/blob/develop/README.md#2025-04-06_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ rake
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Maven Dependency Download Command
DESCRIPTION: Command line instruction to download RxJava dependencies using Maven. Executes the dependency:copy-dependencies goal on a specific POM file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ReactiveX/reactivex.github.io/blob/develop/examples/binaries/maven.txt#2025-04-06_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ mvn -f download-rxjava-pom.xml dependency:copy-dependencies
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding Apache 2.0 License Header to New Source Files
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet provides the standard Apache 2.0 license header that must be included at the top of any new source code files contributed to the ReactiveX.io project. This header is required to maintain license compliance across the codebase.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ReactiveX/reactivex.github.io/blob/develop/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-06_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
/**
 * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
 * you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
 * You may obtain a copy of the License at
 * 
 * http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
 * 
 * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
 * distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
 * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
 * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
 * limitations under the License.
 */
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Displaying Markdown Header for core-iconset-svg
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the Markdown header for the core-iconset-svg component documentation. It includes the component name and a horizontal rule for visual separation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ReactiveX/reactivex.github.io/blob/develop/polymer/components/core-iconset-svg/README.md#2025-04-06_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Markdown
CODE:
```
core-iconset-svg
=========
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining paper-focusable custom element in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines the name of the custom element 'paper-focusable' using a Markdown heading. It does not provide any implementation details or usage instructions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ReactiveX/reactivex.github.io/blob/develop/polymer/components/paper-focusable/README.md#2025-04-06_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
paper-focusable
===============

paper-focusable
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Displaying Markdown Header for Core Icons Component
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the markdown header for the core-icons component, indicating the title of the component and providing a link to more detailed documentation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ReactiveX/reactivex.github.io/blob/develop/polymer/components/core-icons/README.md#2025-04-06_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
core-icons
=========

See the [component page](http://polymer.github.io/core-icons) for more information.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Displaying Core Drawer Panel Component Link in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: This snippet uses Markdown syntax to create a link to the core-drawer-panel component page, providing users with access to more detailed information about the component.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ReactiveX/reactivex.github.io/blob/develop/polymer/components/core-drawer-panel/README.md#2025-04-06_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Markdown
CODE:
```
[component page](http://polymer.github.io/core-drawer-panel)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Markdown Heading and Link Syntax
DESCRIPTION: Basic markdown formatting showing a heading and a link to the core-selector component documentation page
SOURCE: https://github.com/ReactiveX/reactivex.github.io/blob/develop/polymer/components/core-selector/README.md#2025-04-06_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
core-selector\n==============\n\nSee the [component page](http://polymer.github.io/core-selector) for more information.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Providing Link to Component Page in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to create a link in Markdown to the component page for more detailed information about core-iconset-svg.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ReactiveX/reactivex.github.io/blob/develop/polymer/components/core-iconset-svg/README.md#2025-04-06_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: Markdown
CODE:
```
See the [component page](http://polymer.github.io/core-iconset-svg) for more information.
```
